net.sf.mmm.util.lang.base.datatype.descriptor

Class AbstractDatatypeSegmentDescriptor<T,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.lang.base.datatype.descriptor.AbstractDatatypeSegmentDescriptor<T,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - is the generic type of the Datatype owning this segment.
    V - is the generic type of the segment value.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    DatatypeSegmentDescriptor<T,V>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DatatypeDescriptorDate.DaySegment, DatatypeDescriptorDate.HourSegment, DatatypeDescriptorDate.MinuteSegment, DatatypeDescriptorDate.MonthSegment, DatatypeDescriptorDate.SecondSegment, DatatypeDescriptorDate.YearSegment, DatatypeDescriptorLocalDate.DaySegment, DatatypeDescriptorLocalDate.MonthSegment, DatatypeDescriptorLocalDate.YearSegment, DatatypeSegmentDescriptorEnum, DatatypeSegmentDescriptorSimpleDatatype

    public abstract class AbstractDatatypeSegmentDescriptor<T,V>
extends Object
implements DatatypeSegmentDescriptor<T,V>
    This is the implementation of DatatypeSegmentDescriptor.
    Since:
    6.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

        Gets the value of the segment described by this object.

      • doGetSegment

        protected abstract V doGetSegment(T datatype)
        Called from getSegment(Object) after validation (null-check).
        Parameters:
        datatype - is the datatype instance. May not be null.
        Returns:
        the segment value.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Specified by:
        getName in interface DatatypeSegmentDescriptor<T,V>
        Returns:
        the name of the segment. For SimpleDatatype typically just DatatypeSegmentDescriptor.DEFAULT_NAME but significant for composite datatypes where the name is used as field names when the datatype is serialized to XML, JSON, a Map or whatever.

      • getType

        public Class<V> getType()
        Specified by:
        getType in interface DatatypeSegmentDescriptor<T,V>
        Returns:
        the type of the segment. Should typically be a standard Java datatype such as String, Double, Long, Integer, Boolean, BigDecimal, etc. but may also be another custom Datatype.

      • isOptional

        public boolean isOptional()
        Specified by:
        isOptional in interface DatatypeSegmentDescriptor<T,V>
        Returns:
        true if this segment is optional and can be omitted, false otherwise. Serialization is suggested to omit optional segments if their value is null. Further, creation shall accept less arguments if any number of optional arguments are skipped what requires that segment descriptors are ordered such that optional segments are at the end of the list.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
